meanings.definition: Relating to or caused by changes in sea level.
meanings.sent1: The eustatic rise in sea level affected coastal cities.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study eustatic changes to understand climate patterns.
meanings.sent3: The eustatic sea level decided to take a vacation and surprise everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was eustatic, rising and falling like the tides.
meanings.sent5: The eustatic shift in sea level left a lasting impact on marine life.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a uniform or global change in sea level.
meanings.sent1: The eustatic sea level change was consistent across all oceans.
meanings.sent2: The eustatic trend indicated a worldwide shift in water levels.
meanings.sent3: The eustatic sea level threw a party for all the marine creatures.
meanings.sent4: His eustatic vision for the project brought unity to the team.
meanings.sent5: The eustatic alteration in sea level was undeniable and far-reaching.

meanings.definition: Referring to a worldwide or universal phenomenon.
meanings.sent1: The eustatic impact was felt on a global scale.
meanings.sent2: Eustatic events can have widespread implications for ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: The eustatic concept traveled around the world in seconds.
meanings.sent4: Her eustatic perspective on life brought people together.
meanings.sent5: The eustatic nature of the problem required an international solution.
